page.title: 01Location of Rhenigidale
page.content: {RHENIGIDALE}is a small remote village in the Western Isles, which are to the north-west of the mainland of Scotland. There are four occupied houses, a hostel and a school. Twelve people live here and there is also a radio telephone link. There is no road to this village at present so the only way in or out is by sea or on foot. Rhenigidale is on the eastern coast of the island of Harris which is not actually a complete island since it is joined to the larger island of Lewis.When the weather is suitable it is quite easy for a boat to come in and out. Unfortunately when the South Westerly wind is blowing as is often the case it is not possible to land anything. It is four miles to the nearest road by the footpath which joins the road two miles from Tarbert, the nearest shop to Rhenigidale.
